level.text: A court on its own motion may order abduction prevention measures in a child-custody proceeding if the court finds that the evidence establishes a credible risk of abduction of the child.

A party to a child-custody determination or another individual or entity having a right under the law of this state or any other state to seek a child-custody determination for the child may file a petition seeking abduction prevention measures to protect the child under this subchapter.
The Attorney General for the District of Columbia may seek a warrant to take physical custody of a child under ยง 16-4604.09 or other appropriate prevention measures.
